reason: The 'row_cache_save_period' configuration in Cassandra determines how frequently the row cache is persisted to disk. A change in this value can significantly impact system performance because a shorter save period may lead to increased disk I/O, affecting overall throughput and latency, while a longer save period may result in higher memory usage and slower recovery times after a failure. Therefore, variations in this configuration can lead to notable changes in execution time and memory consumption, classifying it as performance-sensitive.
